chunk_analysis.page_text:
ALLEGHENY COUNTY PENNSYLVANIA DEED BOOK VOLUME 2470 179

Indenture to be their act and deed, to the end that it may be recorded as such.
WITNESS my hand and official seal.
Mabel A. Hazlett, Notary Public. (N. P. Seal)
My com. expires Feb. 26, 1933.

CERTIFICATE OF RESIDENCE
I, Frank X. Ciesielski, do hereby certify that my precise residence is Harwick, Pa.
WITNESS my hand this 16th day of May, 1932.
Francis X. McCulloch,
Atty. for Frank X. Ciesielski, et ux.

Registered in Allegheny County, June 6, 1932.
No. 13901 - Recorded June 6, 1932. Time 10:36 A.M.
Written by McCormick; Compared by [signatures]

THIS INDENTURE
MAE E. JONES
TO
ORA R. PITTS, ET UX.

MADE the sixteenth day of September in the year of our Lord one thousand nine hundred and thirty-one (1931). Between MAE E. JONES, widow, (being the widow of former W. Jones, deceased), of Jefferson Township, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, party of the first part and ORA R. PITTS and TINA M. PITTS, his wife, of Dravosburg, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania, parties of the second part;

WITNESSETH, that the said party of the first part, in consideration of One ($1.00) Dollar, and other good and valuable considerations, to part paid by the said parties of the second part, does grant, bargain, sell and convey unto the said parties of the second part, their heirs and assigns:

ALL that certain tract or piece of land situate partly in Union Township, in the County of Washington, and State of Pennsylvania, and partly in Jefferson Township, in County of Allegheny, and State aforesaid, bounded and described as follows, to-wit:

[Detailed property description with measurements follows]

Thirty-one (131) acres, and One Hundred and Thirty-one (131) perches.

THIS conveyance is made under and subject to that oil and gas lease covering the above described land as now held and owned by Carnegie Natural Gas Company. And party of the first part excepts and reserves to herself, her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns, forever, out of and from the force and effect of this conveyance all the right, royalties, income, and profit which now or may hereafter arise by virtue of the aforesaid oil and gas lease. And in the event the said Carnegie Natural Gas Company, its successors or assigns, should at any time hereafter cancel or surrender said oil and gas lease covering the above described land, then, in such event, all the oil and gas in and under the above described land, together with all the wells drilled by virtue of said lease, shall revert to and become the property of the party of the first part, her heirs, executors, administrators, and assigns, in fee simple absolutely, together with such rights and privileges, in the above described land which may be necessary and required in any and all operations for installing and operating for oil and gas in said premises as fully and completely and to the same extent as set forth in said written oil and gas lease held by the said Carnegie Natural Gas Company aforesaid in the said land.

[Additional terms regarding pipe line rights and mortgage details follow]

WITH the appurtenances: TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the same unto and for the use of said parties of the second part, their heirs and assigns forever, subject, however, to the exceptions, reservations, conditions, and stipulations hereinabove mentioned and referred to.

detailed_samples.reasoning: This deed contains an actual, substantive mineral rights reservation, specifically related to oil and gas rights. Here are the key elements that make this a clear mineral rights reservation:
